p: During 2015 and 2016 a cross-sectional study was conducted. A total of 131 owned, free-roaming cats were sampled in six rural communities adjacent to protected areas located in two different regions of southern Chile: four in the Valdivian coastal area (Los Ríos region, 39° S 73° W) and two on Chiloe Island (Los Lagos region, 43° S 73° W) ( Fig. 1). These two regions were chosen since they contain remote and isolated rural communities, where prophylactic management and health care of domestic cats and dogs ( Canis familiaris) is scarce or nonexistent [ 64].
